title: Permanently Banned after 5 years..
body:
Hi,

I was recently permanently banned after 5 years of being on good behavior.

This is how it happened:

Recently, I was in the hospital due to being diagnosed with Ulcerative Colitis. For the past 4-5 months, I've been really sick...so a buddy of mine asked me if he could use my account to duo with his friend. Being the idiot I was, I let him log on and play not thinking of the consequences. Turns out, while he was playing with his friend, he had activated 3rd party scripts.

Thus, we are here today, with a permanent banned account for something I did not do. Was it my fault for letting him on my account? Yes. Should I receive a ban for account sharing? Definitely, seeing as how this must of created a negative experience for other players. But do I really deserve a permanent ban for something I did not do?

I contacted Riot support about this telling them the summoner name of the person who was on the account, and to even check IP addresses, yet he still runs free on his main account elo boosting and scripting while I am perma banned.

I've been a supporter of Riot for 5 years. With a clean ban history, and the amount of time I put into this account, I don't think a permanent ban is justified. Please if any Riot staff member could help me out... I really enjoyed playing this game..

replies.body: Very sad, you know you broke the rules though. Honestly Riot is not going to reverse the decision. Make a new account and start over. I know that sucks, but that is really your only option.

You didn't lose it because of somebody else; you lost it because of you.

Riot does not allow account sharing. You sharing your account, as in giving consent for your friend to use your account, gave your friend access to your account where they clearly used the chance to do what they wanted. 

Riot does not allow a lot of 3rd-party things, your friend used some of these "not-okay" 3rd-party techno-ma-programa-wuts. 

I imagine having a punishment for just one of the two might have been a lot less severe. Because your friend,  while **_having consent_** to use **_your account,_** used what he used, you managed to break two or more of the games rules at once because you are not only responsible for your account but trusted your friend to be responsible with your account.

If you do decide to start the game over add me; I'll be more than happy to play with you because I'll need somebody to celebrate the Harrowing with. In the mean time I hope your health begins to improve and that you won't share your next account.

I'd hate to say it but...
You LET your friend borrow your account. Why the hell does he need YOUR account to duo with his own friend? He could have done that on his own account, and don't give me that tier crap because if they're not in the same rank/elo/whatever-the-heck then they shouldn't be playing ranked together, they can just play norms if they wanna play together.

YOU let him use your account, therefore you accepted ALL the risks of letting someone impersonate you and use your account for whatever the heck they wanted to. It's like letting a friend borrow your credit/debit card to do whatever he wants to do with it and then saying "Wait, I didn't do this, I let my friend use my card and he did this."

If your friend had STOLEN your account, gained access to it, or used it without your permission, that might have been a different story, but you let him use it and gave him the OK for it.

The only other loose end left here is the friendship between you two after this. If they've been a friend of yours for a LONG time, you might consider working something out with them on this. If they refuse to try to compensate you or if they're not really that close of a friend though, you might reconsider keeping them around if they really put you out of a some hundred or thousand dollars over them wanting to be a jerk and compromising your account over boosting their own crappy friend in a damn online game.
